title: Until the Next Time
historical_context: This article reflects the hacker culture of the early 90s, characterized by a blend of dark humor and commentary on corporate greed and violence.
target_audience: Hackers, security professionals, and those interested in hacker culture history.
short_summary: The article narrates a fictional account of a corporate assassination, blending elements of dark humor with a critique of corporate culture and the lengths individuals will go for power and money.
summary: In 'Until the Next Time', Obscure Images presents a gripping narrative that revolves around a hired assassin tasked with executing a corporate president. The protagonist, disguised as a businessman, uses a high-tech plastic gun with explosive ceramic bullets, showcasing a blend of science fiction and corporate espionage. The story unfolds with a darkly comedic tone, as the protagonist reflects on the absurdity of his situation and the moral implications of his actions. The assassination is executed with chilling efficiency, but not without consequences, as the protagonist finds himself wounded and thrust into a ruthless corporate hierarchy where survival depends on eliminating rivals. This tale serves as a satirical commentary on the cutthroat nature of corporate America and the lengths to which individuals will go to climb the corporate ladder, ultimately questioning the value of such ambition in a world where human life is expendable.
additional_notes: The article's blend of humor and violence, along with its critique of corporate culture, makes it a notable piece within the hacker zine landscape of the time.
